casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Manuel Amando FLORES, Jr., Defendant-Appellant. No. 05-20709

Summary Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Dec. 20, 2006. James Lee Turner, Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Southern District of Texas, Houston, TX, for PlaintiffAppellee. Nicole Wignall Deborde, Houston, TX, for Defendant-Appellant. Before DAVIS, BARKSDALE and BENAVIDES, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:*

The attorney appointed to represent Manuel Amando Flores, Jr., has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Flores has filed a response in *286which he argues, inter alia, that counsel was ineffective for not arguing at sentencing and on appeal that Flores should receive a sentencing adjustment for his role in the offense and should not receive a sentencing adjustment for possession of a firearm. Flores also moves for the appointment of new counsel or, alternatively, to remand his case to allow the district court to reconsider its guidelines rulings. The record is sufficiently developed to allow consideration of Flores’s claims of ineffectiveness. See United States v. Higdon, 832 F.2d 312, 314 (5th Cir.1987).

Our independent review of the record, counsel’s brief, and Flores’s response shows that there are no nonfrivolous issues for appeal. Accordingly, the motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and this appeal is DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2. All other outstanding motions are DENIED.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is .not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
